text:
VI
SELECTED BIBLIOGRAPHY
1. TELEVISION FOR CALIFORNIA SCHOOLS
A report of a study made for the California State Department
of Education, by William H. Allen, Special Consultant in
Educational Television to the Bureau of Audio-Visual and
Schpol Library Education, California State Department of
Education. (April 1960)
2. TEACHING BY TELEVISION
A report from the Ford Foundation and the Fund for the
Advancement of Education. (May 1959)
3. THE FEASIBILITY AND ROLE OF STATE AND REGIONAL NETWORKS
IN EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTING
Proceedings of a conference conducted by the National
Association of Educational Broadcasts, at the invitation
of the U. S. Office of Education, under the Provisions of
Title VII of the National Defense Education Act. (Sept. 1959)
4. THE USES OF TELEVISION AT SAN DIEGO STATE COLLEGE
A report of the first yearâ€™s progress covering the period
November 1958 through June 1959.
5. INSTRUCTIONAL CLOSED CIRCUIT TELEVISION
Study reports number 1 and 2, covering the years 1957-58
and 1958-59, respectively. Prepared by the Staff of the
Division of Audio-Visual Services, San Jose State College.
(Sept. 1958 and October 1959)
